title: Satire & Parody Quiz
description: Explore the witty world of satire and parody in literature, from Jonathan Swift to modern comedy

questions.question: What is 'satire' in literature?
options: A poem written in iambic pentameter
The use of humor, irony, or exaggeration to criticize or mock human vices and institutions
A love story with a twist ending

questions.question: What is 'parody'?
options: An imitation of a specific work, author, or genre for comedic or critical effect

questions.question: How does satire differ from parody?
options: Satire criticizes broader social issues; parody specifically imitates a particular work or style
They are exactly the same thing
Parody is always written; satire is always spoken
Satire is always funny; parody never is

questions.question: Jonathan Swift's 'A Modest Proposal,' which ironically suggests eating children to solve poverty, is a famous example of:
What are the two main types of satire named after Roman poets?
Juvenalian satire is characterized by:
options: Harsh, biting, and contemptuous criticism of vice and corruption

questions.question: George Orwell's 'Animal Farm' is a satire of:
What literary technique does satire frequently employ to make its criticisms more effective?
Don Quixote by Cervantes is considered a parody of which genre?
What is a 'lampoon'?
options: A harsh, personal satire directed at an individual
A type of lantern used in theater

questions.question: What is a 'burlesque' in the literary sense?
options: A humorous work that mocks a serious subject by treating it absurdly or treating a trivial subject grandly

questions.question: Mark Twain's 'Adventures of Huckleberry Finn' uses satire primarily to criticize:
options: Racism and hypocrisy in American society

questions.question: What is 'pastiche'?
options: A dramatic technique used in tragedies
A work that imitates the style of another work or artist as a respectful tribute, without mockery
A dish served at literary dinners
A type of satire aimed at politicians

questions.question: Voltaire's 'Candide' satirizes which philosophical idea?
options: The philosophy of optimism, that 'all is for the best in the best of all possible worlds'
